results.abstract: The race for chancellor is tightening, but Angela Merkel says Armin Laschet is the man to fill her shoes.

results.title: Photos of an Eruption: Canary Island Volcano Sends Thousands Fleeing
results.abstract: This is what it looks like in La Palma, where the most powerful volcanic eruption in half a century has upended life for islanders.

multimedia.caption: The eruption on La Palma on Sunday was the first major volcanic activity on the island for 50 years. It could continue for weeks, experts said.

results.title: Has Covid Cost Australia Its Love for Freedom?
results.abstract: Half the country is locked down, and its borders remain closed. But most Australians are willing to make these sacrifices in pursuit of a collective freedom from fear of the virus.

results.title: In Sicily Slums, a 113-Year Wait for Housing May Be Over
results.abstract: After a 1908 earthquake in Messina, the displaced were moved into temporary shacks. Thousands still live in squalor, but the pandemic has pushed Rome to take action at last.

results.title: France, Striving for Global Power, Still Struggles to Get It
results.abstract: Though often seen as vanity or pique, France’s assertiveness abroad is calibrated to manage a quandary it has faced since World War II: how to act as an independent power while depending on allies.

results.abstract: Malka Leifer, who was extradited from Israel after a long battle, pleaded not guilty to 70 counts.

results.title: Top Adviser to Ukrainian President Is Targeted in an Assassination Attempt
results.abstract: President Volodymyr Zelensky said he was returning to Ukraine from New York immediately after giving his U.N. speech. The adviser, Serhiy Shefir, was unharmed, but his driver was shot and wounded in the attack.
results.byline: By Ivan Nechepurenko and Michael Schwirtz

results.title: Biden Declared the War Over. But Wars Go On.
results.abstract: The president’s assertion after the withdrawal from Afghanistan that the United States is not at war for the first time in 20 years ignored continued smaller-scale conflicts.
des_facet: United States Defense and Military Forces

multimedia.caption: President Biden declared before the United Nations on Tuesday that the United States had “turned the page” on its wars. But it was just the latest attempt by an American president to mask the reality of smaller-scale armed conflicts.

results.title: Pressure Grows on U.S. Companies to Share Covid Vaccine Technology
results.abstract: Moderna accepted $2.5 billion in taxpayer money to develop its Covid-19 vaccine. But officials in the U.S. and overseas are having trouble persuading the company to license its technology.

multimedia.caption: A man receiving a Moderna vaccine in Indonesia. Frustration is growing with Moderna, which is not sharing its technology so the poorest nations can produce the shot themselves.
